column4: OK I'm going nuts now... fresh Ubuntu 5.10 install and I just can't get the networking to work. First I thought it was the UTC=yes/no problem mentioned in the bug database, but that didn't help. I just can't get dhclient to work properly. Help!
iface eth0 inet dchp
But I did try manually running dhclient, multiple times...
It just didn't help.
Is it possible to pass on the UTC=yes option to dhclient from the command line?
No I don't have an IP there
Well I'm booted in WinXP now of course
Otherwise I'd have a hard time being on IRC, with no networking under Ubuntu :-)
why not just set a static ip for starters?
how didnt it help? could you ping the router? could you ping the net? what options did you supply??
erm, you need to supply a little more info to ifconfig
ifconfig eth0 192.168.1.42 gateway 192.168.1.0 up  (if 192.168.1.0 is indeed your router ip)
set the router gateway first, then we can sort out the lan stuff once you can irc on it.
wait
i may have led you astray
erm, what commands did you run, and what was the output?
and route output looked good/
try an older kernl.
stick with sarge! :P
but really, try an older/newer kernel. i would even suggest trying and seeing how the debian 2.6 image goes.
its modprobe with 2.6, and yes. modprobe -r, but i doubt it will change anything.
what version of debian worked with the card?
